content: On the streets near Tiananmen Square early on June 4, two men were taken away by police for unknown reasons. Witnesses said that the two men were sitting on a bench when they were questioned by the police and taken away.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Netizens submitted a post about the alert situation in Beijing on June 4

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On June 4, the 35th anniversary of the June 4th Incident was commemorated in front of the Chinese Embassy in London

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
A tape recording currently stored in the Harvard-Yenching Library records the final moments before the evacuation of Tiananmen Square in the early morning of June 4.
At the beginning of the recording, news of casualties from all over Beijing had already reached the square, and student representatives shouted "Li Peng's death is not enough to appease the public anger" and "severely punish the murderer."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 4, Hong Kong. The windows of the U.S. Consulate General in Hong Kong and Macau are once again filled with candles.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Speech by Johnny Yang, founding president of the Canadian Citizens Association, at the U.S. Congressional CECC-China Committee.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: @xiaojingcanxue Only when the older generation realizes what they can do for the new generation, hope can really become a reality, rather than just being passed down from generation to generation

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Security situation on Urumqi Middle Road in Shanghai on June 5

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On June 3, Guo Jianyu, chairman of the Qin County CPPCC and former deputy county magistrate in Shanxi Province, was murdered with a knife.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Reuters reported on several Henan bank depositors who were detained after traveling to Zhengzhou during the Spring Festival.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On June 4, an article on Hu Xijin's official account criticizing Tietou for peeing and graffiti at the Yasukuni Shrine was banned. 
Previously, he had posted a long article on Weibo criticizing Tietou's behavior, saying that such behavior of gaining traffic and hype was not patriotism.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Chinese Academy of Social Sciences University

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Scene 7 of June 4:
1. At least eight bodies were placed in the corridor of a hospital
2. The deceased was a priest, and the Post and Telecommunications Hospital could only place the body outdoors
3. The utility room of the hospital was also filled with bodies in all directions
4. Several bodies were temporarily placed in a corner of the house.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Nine scenes on the day of June 4:
1. The martial law troops stopped and checked two citizens, and the scene was tense.
2. A group of military police beat up a lone citizen.
3. A citizen was arrested by the soldiers.
4. On the morning of June 4, a group of soldiers were escorting several students who refused to leave the square.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On the 35th anniversary of June 4th, we cooperated with Human Rights in China @hrichina and Humane China @HChina89 to release a series of special photos of June 4th. Scene of the 1989 Democracy Movement No. 23 (June 5)
["Tank Man" appeared in the square, his identity is still a mystery] [Someone witnessed martial law soldiers shooting a teenager]

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On June 4, at the regular press conference of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, spokesman Mao Ning responded to the comments made by various governments on the 35th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square Incident, saying, "The Chinese government has already made a clear conclusion on this matter. We oppose anyone using this as an excuse to attack and smear China." However, these two questions were deleted in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs press release.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Ministry of Foreign Affairs Press Release

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On the evening of June 4, students from a high school in Guangdong launched a shouting activity to cheer for the senior year. During the activity, a student waved the Palestinian flag and ran.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: A shopping mall in Nanjing notified all merchants on June 1 that their display screens could not be turned on.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: https://t.co/cn577djeiM

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Recently, Luoyang City, Henan Province, issued measures to encourage retired military personnel to teach in primary and secondary schools. The measures introduced a number of preferential measures for retired military personnel at all levels in Luoyang City when recruiting primary and secondary school teachers, including separate recruitment plans, relaxation of age restrictions, extension of the validity period of teacher qualification examination certificates, and special support for additional points.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 3, Zaozhuang, Shandong. A parent posted a complaint about the high tuition fees for kindergartens, saying, "I earn 3,000 yuan but pay 2,000 yuan for tuition fees." Many netizens expressed the same sentiment in the comments section, saying that their own kindergartens are more expensive.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 3, Harbin, Heilongjiang. A netizen said that he was stopped and forbidden to enter the Hagia Sophia wearing a horse-faced skirt and was accused of being a strange dress. The other party said, "The leaders have stipulated that people wearing strange clothes are not allowed to enter, and you can only enter in ordinary clothes." The scenic spot later stated that traditional costumes can be entered, and the staff did not fully understand the clothes.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On June 3, at the regular press conference of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, spokesman Mao Ning said: China's non-participation in the Swiss Peace Conference does not mean that it does not support peace. 
This was ridiculed by netizens.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
June 3, Shenyang, Liaoning. A shop owner posted a video saying that a man tripped over a stone pier outside his restaurant that day, and then his colleagues called the police. According to the shop owner, this stone pier does not belong to his shop and has always been there.
After the police heard the clerk denying that Shi Dun was from his own store, they thought the clerk was lying. They suddenly had a bad attitude and started swearing. They even snatched the clerk's cell phone and took him away.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 3, Zhaoyuan, Shandong. Haiyi Environmental Protection Technology Co., Ltd. continued to emit harmful gases, causing fever and sore throats in nearby residents. Residents blocked the road to protect their rights and demanded an explanation from the government.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On the evening of June 4, a high school in Guizhou also launched a campaign to support Palestine. Students shouted "Liberate Palestine!"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Recently, brands such as Disney and Estee Lauder have sparked dissatisfaction and boycotts among netizens after being told to donate to Israel.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 3, Nanjing, Jiangsu. The property management of Agile Garden Community has been in arrears of cleaning wages for four or five months, and the workers went on strike to demand their wages.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: June 2, Shenzhen, Guangdong. A man posted a video saying, "Because of my bad legs, I work in a small factory in Shenzhen and earn only 8 yuan per hour."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On June 4, it was reported online that Peking University history professor Shang Xiaoming issued a statement to all teachers, announcing his resignation from the History Department Degree Committee.
It is reported that the reason was that at the History Department Degree Committee on the 2nd, the student paper he supervised, "A Study of Britain's Policy on the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom", was questioned by the committee members and caused controversy because of one sentence "Chinese and foreign reactionary forces jointly suppressed the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Zhou Fengsuo, a leader of the June 4th student movement, delivered a speech at a U.S. congressional hearing and displayed evidence of the June 4th massacre at the scene - a blood-stained towel.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In the early morning of June 4, players in a game called "New Hot Blood Heroes" changed their room names and nicknames to commemorate the 35th anniversary of June 4. At 5 a.m. that day, the game urgently closed the relevant name-changing function.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On the evening of June 5, a university in Gansu issued a notice warning people to guard against exploiting students' sympathy to instigate activities in support of Palestine.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
American students support Palestine: Is this external incitement? This is deafening opposition!
Chinese students support Palestine: Beware of students being used by foreign criminals and do not do things that disrupt public order and undermine social stability.
